plugins.name: Ripplix - Animation Library
plugins.description:
Ripplix ‚Äî friction-free design hand-off with motion

Skip the time-consuming prototypes and pin real-world interactions straight onto your Figma file.

Ripplix already has a curated library of 1 500 + micro-interactions from 300 + live apps & sites into an easy-to-search sidebar. One click drops a comment tag on the exact UI element (button, card, tab‚Ä¶) and links to a full-screen preview on ripplix.com so developers instantly see how it should feel‚Äîtiming, easing, choreography and all.


Why you‚Äôll use it every hand-off

  1. Contextual pins ‚Äì Each animation is attached as a Figma comment on the layer you select, so engineers don‚Äôt have to hunt for it.
  2. Real-app reference ‚Äì Every clip comes from production UIs, giving devs proven motion patterns instead of speculative mocks.
  3. Search that speaks UX ‚Äì Filter by platform (Web, iOS, Android, Watch), pattern (hover, dropdown, empty state‚Ä¶), industry or keyword.
  4. One-click preview ‚Äì Comment contains a ‚ÄúView on Ripplix‚Äù link ‚Üí opens the HD interaction with playback controls, frame counter and downloadable Lottie/CSS snippets.
  5. Zero bloat ‚Äì Nothing is embedded in the Figma file except a tiny thumbnail + link, so your files stay light.


Typical Workflow

  1. Select a layer that needs motion polish.
  2. In the Ripplix sidebar search ‚Äúhover + dropdown‚Äù.
  3. Preview candidates; click Add to Figma.
  4. A comment tag appears on your layer, click upon you can preview the motion.
  5. During hand-off, devs open the link, watch the real interaction, and build it confident they‚Äôre matching the reference.


Need help or want to suggest an animation we‚Äôre missing?

üìß support@ripplix.com


Install Ripplix ‚Üí pin a motion reference ‚Üí ship delightful, on-brand interactions‚Äîwithout another endless prototype.
plugins.tagline: Inspiring for better Interaction

plugins.name: Renamer
plugins.description:
Renamer for Figma


Plugin for finding and replacing text in layer and variable names, with automatic naming convention conversion.


Features


  1. Layer renaming: Quickly find and replace text in layer names
  2. Layer type filtering: frames, text, components, images, etc.
  3. Variable support: find and replace in variable names
  4. Flexible filtering options for variables: search by full name, path only, or name only
  5. Auto-renaming: Convert layer names to different naming conventions automatically
  6. Naming conventions: Support for camelCase, PascalCase, snake_case, kebab-case, flatcase, dotcase, and spacecase
  7. Live preview: See how names will look before applying changes
  8. Revert functionality: Restore original names after renaming
  9. Dot case support: Special support for CSS class-style naming with leading dots (.class-name)


How to use


For layers:


1. Select the "Layers" tab

2. Choose the layer types to search

3. Enter text to find

4. Enter text to replace

5. Enable/disable case sensitivity

6. Click "Rename"

7. If needed, click "Revert" to restore original names


Auto-renaming:


1. Select the "Auto" tab

2. Choose the layer types to rename

3. Select the desired naming convention (camelCase, PascalCase, etc.)

4. See the live preview of how names will be converted

5. Click "Rename" to apply the changes

6. If needed, click "Revert" to restore original names


For variables:


1. Select the "Variables" tab

2. Choose the search filter:

- All - search the entire variable name

- Path - search only in the path (all parts before the last "/")

- Name - search only in the name (part after the last "/")

3. Enter text to find

4. Enter text to replace

5. Enable/disable case sensitivity

6. Click "Rename"


Troubleshooting


If the plugin cannot find variables:

1. Make sure there are variables in the file

2. Check that variables are available on the current page

3. Try restarting the plugin

4. Ensure that your Figma version supports variables


If auto-renaming doesn't work as expected:

1. Note that auto-renaming currently works only for layers, not for variables

2. Make sure you've selected the correct layer types to rename

3. If you need to undo changes, use the "Revert" button

plugins.name: Text2palette
plugins.description:
Turn your ideas into stunning color palettes in seconds! ‚ú® text2palette uses AI to generate beautiful, well-balanced color schemes based on any text prompt. Whether you're designing UI, graphics, branding, or illustrations, this plugin makes color selection effortless.


üîπ How It Works:

  1. Describe your vision (e.g., "Sunset in Tokyo" or "Cyberpunk Neon").
  2. Choose the number of colors (2-8).
  3. Generate & preview your AI-powered palette.
  4. Insert the colors as rectangles in Figma with one click.


üåô Sleek UI with dark mode, gradient styling, and shadows for a modern look.

‚ö° Optimized for UI/UX, graphic design, and digital art.

plugins.name: Quick Section
plugins.description:
Features

  1. Create sections without manually changing colors each time.
  2. Add headers to organize your frames horizontally or vertically.
  3. Access features through the UI or quick menu actions.
  4. Set up keyboard shortcuts to perform quick menu actions faster.


How it works

  1. Select the layers you want to organize.
  2. Click an option from the UI or run it from the plugin menu.
  3. Sections and headers are created and aligned to your selections.


Alternatively, you can add sections or headers directly on the canvas without selecting any layers.

plugins.name: Component Crafter
plugins.description:
Quickly and easily create and manage your components


Features


1.Create Components or Component Sets

Convert any selected layers into components or component sets, with an option to replace them with their instances.


2.Add layers Directly to Existing Components


3.Replace with Component Instances

Swap selected layers with component instances for better design consistency.


4.Advanced Selection Options

Select layers by shared properties before converting them into components.


5.Clone as New Components


6.Instance Management

  1. Select instances on the current page.
  2. Detach instances on the page or across the file.


7.Detach Components

Break components into editable layers while preserving their appearance.


8.Decompose a Component


9.Multi-Language Support
plugins.tagline: Quickly and easily create and manage your components

plugins.name: Unit Converter Pro - Measurement Calculator for Figma
plugins.description:
Unit Converter Pro - The Ultimate Measurement Calculator for Figma

Transform your design workflow with the most comprehensive unit conversion tool available for Figma. Unit Converter Pro instantly converts between any measurement units across 8 different categories, saving you valuable design time.

Features:

‚Ä¢ Convert between ALL common design units: pixels, inches, cm, points, and more

‚Ä¢ Support for 8 conversion categories: Length, Area, Volume, Weight, Temperature, Time, Speed, and Data

‚Ä¢ Real-time conversion as you type - see results instantly

‚Ä¢ Clean, intuitive interface that matches Figma's design language

‚Ä¢ Works directly within your Figma workspace - no need to switch between apps

Perfect for:

  1. Handles spaces and special characters (e.g., /)

plugins.name: Color Nexus
plugins.description:
Color is one of the most important tools for designers. Beyond its intrinsic properties, design also requires attention to the combination, contrast, and harmony between colors.To address these needs, we created Color Nexus, To present the contrast and harmony between colors, making the analysis and adjustment process more intuitive, professional, and convenient.


ColorNexus v2.0

New Feature: Intelligent Image Color Extraction

Easily extract three sets of professional color palettes from any image! ColorNexus v2.0 utilizes multiple advanced algorithms to provide diverse color inspirations for your designs.


V2.0 Key Features:

  1. Multi-Algorithm Support: Different algorithms are used to extract color palettes, ensuring diversity and uniqueness.
  2. Quick Switching: One-click to switch between different color schemes, making the operation simple and reliable.
  3. Flexible Adjustment: Adjust the extracted colors freely according to project requirements.


Operation Steps:

1.Select an Image: Choose any image in your Figma document.

2.One-Click Extraction: Click the image icon to quickly extract a color scheme.

3.Freely Switch and Adjust: Click the image icon repeatedly to switch between the three sets of color palettes. You can also fine-tune the extracted colors according to your needs. ColorNexus provides convenient color adjustment tools.


ColorNexusV1.0

Key Features:

  1. In ColorNexus, you can adjust the hue values of a group of colors within the same color wheel, intuitively observing the angular positional relationships of each color on the wheel. This allows you to quickly identify whether they are complementary colors, analogous colors, or any other contrasting relationships.


  1. ColorNexus utilizes the HSL model, ensuring that hue, saturation, and lightness are presented in a symmetrical relationship, providing a reliable foundation for your color analysis. Simultaneously, each color's saturation and lightness are displayed on the adjustment axis, allowing you to gauge the contrast strength by their positions relative to each other‚Äîthe further apart they are, the more intense the contrast. This empowers you to create a myriad of color combinations.


  1. Additionally, ColorNexus supports one-click switching between RGB and RYB modes, enabling you to view color contrasts that are more aligned with traditional art theories.


  1. Overall, ColorNexus not only helps you create a harmonious and visually pleasing set of colors but also ensures that these colors form an organic whole, rather than isolated individual elements.


Color Addition Methods:

Extract colors from Figma documents.

Input 16-digit hexadecimal color values.

Quickly add basic colors.


Color Output:

After adjustments, hover over the color block and click the download icon to export the color to the current Figma canvas.


Use Cases:

Starting from Scratch: Use ColorNexus to create a brand-new color palette.

Expanding Existing Tones: Input one or several tones and easily add more colors to complement them.

Inspiration Capture: Input beautiful color combinations into ColorNexus, which will display the relationships between colors, helping you better understand and adjust them, thereby improving your color adjustment skills.


Tips:

The RYB color wheel does not support hue adjustments because its color gamut has a nonlinear relationship with RGB, and RGB is the most accurate for adjustments on computers.

The color wheel's drag handle automatically avoids overlap when hues are close, making operation convenient.

With a clean interface that matches Figma's light and dark themes, ColorNexus runs quickly and smoothly, making it an ideal color adjustment plugin.
plugins.tagline: effortlessly combine colors

plugins.name: Token Loader
plugins.description:
Generate a `tokens.json` using something like Style Dictionary.


example tokens.json:


[
{
"name": "core/color/black",
"value": "#000000"
},
{
"name": "alias/color/black",
"value": "#000000",
"aliasOf": "core/color/black"
}
]


Typescript types for the tokens:


interface VariableToken {
name: string; // an/example/name
value: unknown;
}

interface AliasToken extends VariableToken {
aliasOf: VariableToken['name'];
}

type Token = VariableToken | AliasToken;


Next, you can drop in that tokens.json on the plugin window to automatically generate tokens.


Note! It will drop unused ones from the collection, and update existing.
plugins.tagline: A plugin to load tokens (from StyleDictionary), and convert them in to Local Variables

plugins.name: Protege AI
plugins.description:
Protege AI for Figma: Legal Compliance, Simplified

Contact founders@protegecounsel.ai to get a trial account.


In the dynamic realm of marketing, aligning content with legal standards is crucial yet challenging. Protege AI for Figma is crafted to empower in-house legal teams, offering a robust tool to review marketing materials quickly and effectively. This Figma plugin integrates flawlessly into your design workflow, using advanced AI to identify and highlight legal concerns in real time.


Key Features:


  1. Automated Content Analysis: Deploy state-of-the-art AI to scan designs for legal issues like copyright infringement, regulatory non-compliance, and sensitive language.
  2. Real-Time Feedback: Instantly receive suggestions and edits within Figma, enabling swift adjustments and compliance checks.
  3. Customizable Legal Libraries: Adjust the AI‚Äôs scanning abilities to match your specific legal standards and requirements, ensuring a tailored and relevant review.
  4. Collaborative Review Process:** Enhance cooperation between legal and marketing teams with in-document comments and edits, making the review and approval process smoother.
  5. Comprehensive Reporting:** Produce in-depth reports on the legal review process, including issues identified and resolutions, for compliance tracking and audit trails.


Benefits:


  1. Save Time and Resources: Significantly cut down on the time dedicated to reviewing marketing materials, freeing your legal team for more strategic tasks.
  2. Enhance Accuracy: Reduce the risk of missing legal issues with the AI‚Äôs detailed analysis.
  3. Improve Collaboration: Foster a more efficient and collaborative relationship between your legal and marketing departments.
  4. Ensure Compliance: Keep up with changes in regulations with an AI tool that adapts to new legal standards.


Ideal For:


  1. In-house legal teams aiming to enhance the review of marketing content directly within Figma.
  2. Marketing teams looking to accelerate compliance and mitigate legal risks in their creative.
  3. Legal professionals seeking to utilize technology for more efficient and integrated workflows.
plugins.tagline: Protege AI: Streamline Legal Reviews for Creative & Marketing

plugins.name: MTG Deckbuilding Tools
plugins.description:
If you love brewing decks for Magic the Gathering, you may feel frustrated with the tools available to you. If only there was a super fluid and performant digital canvas that could let you seamlessly organize and brainstorm decks... Oh wait that's figma!


Normally you'd have to copy and paste all the cards from a decklist into figma. This plugin makes it 100x easier by letting you just paste in a decklist and automatically place images of the cards you're considering into a figma file.


When you're done, you can export a decklist to go buy cards with online or put into Arena or etc. for playing.
plugins.tagline: Import and Export Magic Decklists

plugins.name: Voice to Text for Figma
plugins.description:
Easily insert text into Figma using your voice!

Click ‚ÄúOpen Voice Tool‚Äù ‚Üí Start speaking in the browser ‚Üí Your speech will be transcribed and automagically added into your selected Figma text layer.

No typing. Just talking.


‚úÖ Use Case 1:

‚ÄúTired of switching between docs and Figma just to copy-paste written content?‚Äù

Speak directly into the plugin‚Äôs voice tool and instantly push the transcription into your selected text box‚Äîno tab switching, no distractions.


‚úÖ Use Case 2:

‚ÄúWant to insert longer text into your Figma design without typing it all out?‚Äù

Use Voice to Text for Figma to dictate your content and have it transcribed directly into your design‚Äîperfect for mockups, user flows, or note-taking during brainstorming.


Supported Features & Limits:

‚úÖ Languages Supported: English, Arabic, Chinese (Simplified), Dutch, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish

üïê Time Limit: Records up to 60 seconds per session, auto-warns you before timeout

üåê Browser Compatibility:

‚úÖ Supported: Google Chrome, Safari, Opera, Samsung Internet

‚ö†Ô∏è Partially Supported: Microsoft Edge, Firefox

‚ùå Not Supported: Internet Explorer, Brave, Arc

üß† Auto-restart: On silence to ensure smoother capture

üéô Microphone Permission : Detects and guidance for Mac & Windows users.

üñ•Ô∏è Figma Compatibility: Works seamlessly on both Figma Browser and Figma Desktop / Mac App

‚úÖ Accessibility Enhancements

‚ù§Ô∏è Open Source Code: https://github.com/mryeshwanth/voice-figma-plugin


How it works:

  1. When you click Open Voice Tool, a new browser window will open to start recording.
  2. This is required because Figma Mac/Desktop plugins can‚Äôt access your microphone directly.
  3. The tool uses your browser's built-in Web Speech API (SpeechRecognition) to transcribe your voice locally ‚Äî nothing is sent to any external server.
  4. Once done, the transcription is securely sent back to the Figma plugin and inserted into your selected text node.
plugins.tagline: Convert your voice to text, directly into Figma.

plugins.name: Text Calculator
plugins.description:
Text Calculator allows Figma users to perform mathematical operations directly within text layers.


The plugin keeps the text layer's original styles intact, including fonts and applied text styles.


To use, simply select a text layer, type your formula (e.g., 5+5), and click the "Calculate" button.


Perfect for designers needing quick calculations while maintaining design consistency.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly perform calculations in text layers.

plugins.description:

plugins.name: Gridder
plugins.description:
A simple tool to generate grids and/or sort layers in ascending or descending layer name order.


How to use


Sorting: Select a group of layers, then select the sort direction.

Gridding: Select a group of layers, then select either the column count or row count. Then adjust the spacing values.


Combine the two use for rapid organized grid creation and maintenance.


From yours truly,

Ryan Nono

plugins.name: Change Text Field by ID
plugins.description:
A very simple plugin allowing you to set the text of a figma Text element by referencing it's internal node ID.

One way you can get the node ID of your text elements is by fetching your figma 'file' layout data via the figma file API end-point: https://api.figma.com/v1/files/${FIGMA_FILE_KEY}

Then look for your text element and identify it's corresponding ID field.

Else you could try using the 'Text node name to id' plugin.
plugins.tagline: Set the text of a Text element by referencing its node ID

plugins.name: ArcTouch Flutter Theme Generator
plugins.description:
Generate Text Styles

Automatically creates a TextStyleTheme class based on all text styles in your Figma project. This class extends ThemeExtension, allowing seamless integration into your Flutter theme.


Generate Theme

Generates a ColorTheme for each variable collection in your project. Each collection is converted into a ThemeExtension to be used within your Flutter theme. If multiple collections lead to class name conflicts, you can easily rename them in your project.


Generate Color Styles

Creates a const class containing color definitions. This is ideal for projects without design tokens or those that don‚Äôt require color variations, providing simple, static color constants.


Generate Design Tokens

Creates const classes for design tokens such as spacings, paddings, and borders.



----------


Meet ArcTouch

ArcTouch creates lovable apps, websites, and connected experiences. Our Flutter development team helps companies design and develop successful cross-platform applications.


Contact us to learn how Flutter can accelerate your product roadmap and maximize your ROI.

accepted.name: ArcTouch

plugins.tagline: Generate Flutter ThemeExtension Classes from Figma Variables and Text Styles

128946.name: ArcTouch Flutter Theme Generator
128946.description:
Generate Text Styles

Automatically creates a TextStyleTheme class based on all text styles in your Figma project. This class extends ThemeExtension, allowing seamless integration into your Flutter theme.


Generate Theme

Generates a ColorTheme for each variable collection in your project. Each collection is converted into a ThemeExtension to be used within your Flutter theme. If multiple collections lead to class name conflicts, you can easily rename them in your project.


Generate Color Styles

Creates a const class containing color definitions. This is ideal for projects without design tokens or those that don‚Äôt require color variations, providing simple, static color constants.


Generate Design Tokens

Creates const classes for design tokens such as spacings, paddings, and borders.



----------


Meet ArcTouch

ArcTouch creates lovable apps, websites, and connected experiences. Our Flutter development team helps companies design and develop successful cross-platform applications.


Contact us to learn how Flutter can accelerate your product roadmap and maximize your ROI.

–î–ª—è —Ç–µ—Ö, –∫—Ç–æ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–π–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ø–∞–ª —Å—é–¥–∞:


–≠—Ç–æ—Ç –ø–ª–∞–≥–∏–Ω –±—ã–ª —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–Ω –¥–ª—è –ø–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –°–ú–ò –∏ –Ω–µ –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª—Å—è –¥–ª—è —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è.


–ï—Å–ª–∏ –≤–∞—à —Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞—Ä–∏–π –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –ø–æ–¥ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –ø–ª–∞–≥–∏–Ω, –≤—ã –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –µ–≥–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–æ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º–∏ –ª–æ–≥–æ—Ç–∏–ø–∞–º–∏. –î–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –≤–∞–º –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ:

  3. –ó–∞–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–º–æ–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç –Ω–∞ —Å–≤–æ–π –ª–æ–≥–æ—Ç–∏–ø (–∂–µ–ª–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –≤ –≤–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω–æ–º —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–µ) - –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –¥–≤–µ –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏–∏: –≤ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–º —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é—Ç—Å—è –æ–±—ã—á–Ω–∞—è –∏ —Ç–µ–º–Ω–∞—è, –Ω–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –ª—é–±—ã–µ
